role.descr: entity created //transcription or translation or process//
specific location of tissue or cell //mostly saying about exon or intron//

example.text: Aggregation and secretion have been initiated by platelet agonists by activating receptors coupled to the G-protein G(q), thereby raising cytosolic Ca(2+), [Ca(2+)](i).
example.arg: activating receptors coupled to the G-protein G(q)

example.text: Apparently HeLa cells are able to either initiate transcription at multiple sites within RPS14 exon 1, or cap 5 oligonucleotides which were removed from most S14 mRNAs posttranscription.

example.text: SCF, like the other dimeric ligands, initates signal transduction by direct dimerization of its receptor, Kit, and the two juxtaposed receptors undergo tyrosine autophosphorylation (Heldin, 1995; Broudy, 1997), which initiated downstream intracellular signaling.

example.text: Since RTKs is observed to initiate signaling by recruiting downstream components to the activated receptor, proteins that are immediately downstream of an activated RTK can be identified by first identifying sequences in the RTK that are necessary to activate downstream signaling (Schlessinger and Ullrich, 1992; Pawson, 1995).
example.arg: recruiting downstream components to the activated receptor

example.text: Sxl is a key regulator of sex determination and dosage compensation, whose transcription has been initiated only in female blastoderm embryos.

example.text: Tumours with breakpoints just 5 to exon 1, or distant from c-myc, have normal c-myc mRNAs of 2.25 and 2.4 kb, which differ at their 5 ends, while tumours with breakpoints within exon 1 or intron 1 alter c-myc mRNAs (2.1-2.7 kb in Burkitt lines), which is initiated within intron 1.

Tumours with breakpoints just 5 to exon 1, or distant from c-myc, have normal c-myc mRNAs of 2.25 and 2.4 kb, which differ at their 5 ends, while tumours with breakpoints within exon 1 or intron 1 alter c-myc mRNAs (2.1-2.7 kb in Burkitt lines), which is observed to be initiated within intron 1.

Tumours with breakpoints just 5 to exon 1, or distant from c-myc, have normal c-myc mRNAs of 2.25 and 2.4 kb, which differ at their 5 ends, while tumours with breakpoints within exon 1 or intron 1 alter c-myc mRNAs (2.1-2.7 kb in Burkitt lines), which will be initiated within intron 1.

Tumours with breakpoints just 5 to exon 1, or distant from c-myc, have normal c-myc mRNAs of 2.25 and 2.4 kb, which differ at their 5 ends, while tumours with breakpoints within exon 1 or intron 1 alter c-myc mRNAs that is believed to be initiated within intron 1.

Tumours with breakpoints just 5 to exon 1, or distant from c-myc, have normal c-myc mRNAs of 2.25 and 2.4 kb, which differ at their 5 ends, while tumours with breakpoints within exon 1 or intron 1 alter c-myc mRNAs that is initiated within intron 1.

Tumours with breakpoints just 5 to exon 1, or distant from c-myc, have normal c-myc mRNAs of 2.25 and 2.4 kb, which differ at their 5 ends, while tumours with breakpoints within exon 1 or intron 1 alter c-myc mRNAs that is initiated within intron 1.

Since Platelet agonists initiate aggregation and secretion by activating receptors coupled to the G-protein G(q), proteins that are immediately downstream of an activated RTK can be identified by first identifying sequences in the RTK that are necessary to activate downstream signaling (Schlessinger and Ullrich, 1992; Pawson, 1995).
